abstract: Many investors appeared to have second thoughts about their first reaction to the Fed’s move to lower rates.
snippet: Many investors appeared to have second thoughts about their first reaction to the Fed’s move to lower rates.
lead_paragraph: A day that dawned bleakly on Wall Street turned even darker late yesterday as an afternoon sell-off sent the Dow Jones industrial average down more than 360 points, or 2.6 percent. Investors worried that Citigroup’s woes might be worsening and that consumers would not spend freely this holiday shopping season.

headline.main: In Wild Swing, Stocks Give Up Rate-Cut Gains
headline.print_headline: In Wild Swing, Stocks Give Up Rate-Cut Gains
